title: Wild rice salad with peas, pea shoots and green harissa
portion: Serves 6-8 as a starter or side dish
time: Hands-on time 15 min, simmering time 30 min
description: A summery, vegetarian rice salad recipe full of fresh flavours and with a kick of chilli â€“ from the chefs at Mildreds restaurant in Soho, London.
ingredients: Bunch fresh flat leaf parsley, leaves picked
2 green chillies, deseeded and finely chopped

method.Step 1: Bring a pan of salted water to the boil. Add the rice, reduce to a simmer and cook for about 30 minutes or until tender. Add the peas for the last 5 minutes. Drain the rice and peas and run under cold water until cool, then set aside (see make ahead).

method.Step 2: Thinly slice the spring onions and roughly chop the cucumber and herbs, then put in a large bowl. Add the chopped chillies to the bowl along with the cooled rice and peas. Toss through the green harissa, grated lemon zest and juice, then garnish with the pea shoots to serve
